title: Drawing, "Juno Watches the Slaying of Argus", 1650–1700
medium: Red chalk, pen and ink, brush and bistre wash on paper
markings: Stamp in black, lower right: Jan Pieterszen Zoomer (Lugt 1511)
provenance: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Mercury raises the head of Argus with his left hand, addressing himself to Juno whose peacocks stand before her. The corpse lies in the foreground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Juno Watches the Slaying of Argus", 1650–1700.
1650–1700. Red chalk, pen and ink, brush and bistre wash on paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-266.
